trans-unit.source: Create an Azure worker role to poll the Azure blob
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure worker role to poll the Azure blob

trans-unit.source: In the previous steps we created an <token>af_integration</token> bridge that receives the purchase order message from the customer, maps it to an X12 850, then routes it to a <embeddedLabel>purchaseorder</embeddedLabel> blob container.
trans-unit.target: In the previous steps we created an <token>af_integration</token> bridge that receives the purchase order message from the customer, maps it to an X12 850, then routes it to a <embeddedLabel>purchaseorder</embeddedLabel> blob container.

trans-unit.source: We also created an X12 agreement using the <token>tpm_portal</token> to receive an X12 850 purchase order message, the message is then sent to the Fourth Coffee restaurant.
trans-unit.target: We also created an X12 agreement using the <token>tpm_portal</token> to receive an X12 850 purchase order message, the message is then sent to the Fourth Coffee restaurant.

trans-unit.source: In this step, we use an <token>azure_2</token> worker role that polls the <embeddedLabel>purchaseorder</embeddedLabel> blob container.
trans-unit.target: In this step, we use an <token>azure_2</token> worker role that polls the <embeddedLabel>purchaseorder</embeddedLabel> blob container.

trans-unit.source: It then sends the X12 850 purchase order blob to the X12 send bridge that is deployed as part of the X12 agreement.
trans-unit.target: It then sends the X12 850 purchase order blob to the X12 send bridge that is deployed as part of the X12 agreement.

trans-unit.source: This topic does not go into the details of creating an <token>winzaure2</token> worker role.
trans-unit.target: This topic does not go into the details of creating an <token>winzaure2</token> worker role.

trans-unit.source: You can download the <embeddedLabel>BlobPollerRole</embeddedLabel> worker role sample from <externalLink><linkText>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=390152</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=390152</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: You can download the <embeddedLabel>BlobPollerRole</embeddedLabel> worker role sample from <externalLink><linkText>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=390152</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=390152</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: You must make the following changes to the role configuration to use it in your environment.
trans-unit.target: You must make the following changes to the role configuration to use it in your environment.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Make sure you have the <token>azure_2</token> SDK for .NET is installed on the computer where you are using the worker role.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you have the <token>azure_2</token> SDK for .NET is installed on the computer where you are using the worker role.

trans-unit.source: You can download the SDK from <externalLink><linkText>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=378265</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=378265</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: You can download the SDK from <externalLink><linkText>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=378265</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=378265</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Update the worker role configuration
trans-unit.target: Update the worker role configuration

trans-unit.source: Make the following changes to use the <embeddedLabel>BlobPollerRole</embeddedLabel> worker role in your <token>azure_2</token> subscription.
trans-unit.target: Make the following changes to use the <embeddedLabel>BlobPollerRole</embeddedLabel> worker role in your <token>azure_2</token> subscription.

trans-unit.source: Open the <embeddedLabel>BlobPollerRole</embeddedLabel> solution and in the Solution Explorer, expand <embeddedLabel>BlobPollerRole</embeddedLabel>, expand <embeddedLabel>Roles</embeddedLabel>, and then double-click <embeddedLabel>BlobPollerWorkerRole</embeddedLabel> to open the properties for this role.
trans-unit.target: Open the <embeddedLabel>BlobPollerRole</embeddedLabel> solution and in the Solution Explorer, expand <embeddedLabel>BlobPollerRole</embeddedLabel>, expand <embeddedLabel>Roles</embeddedLabel>, and then double-click <embeddedLabel>BlobPollerWorkerRole</embeddedLabel> to open the properties for this role.

trans-unit.source: On the Settings tab, make the following changes to the configuration properties.
trans-unit.target: On the Settings tab, make the following changes to the configuration properties.

trans-unit.source: ACSAddress
trans-unit.target: ACSAddress

trans-unit.source: Provide the ACS URL associated with your <token>af_integration</token> subscription.
trans-unit.target: Provide the ACS URL associated with your <token>af_integration</token> subscription.

trans-unit.source: IssuerName
trans-unit.target: IssuerName

trans-unit.source: Provide the issuer name for the ACS namespace.
trans-unit.target: Provide the issuer name for the ACS namespace.

trans-unit.source: IssuerKey
trans-unit.target: IssuerKey

trans-unit.source: Provide the issuer key for the ACS namespace.
trans-unit.target: Provide the issuer key for the ACS namespace.

trans-unit.source: PipelineAdderss
trans-unit.target: PipelineAdderss

trans-unit.source: Enter the pipeline endpoint where the blob poller must direct the message after reading from the blob.
trans-unit.target: Enter the pipeline endpoint where the blob poller must direct the message after reading from the blob.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, this must be the endpoint where the EDI X12 send agreement is deployed.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, this must be the endpoint where the EDI X12 send agreement is deployed.

trans-unit.source: You can get the endpoint from Send Settings tab (Inbound URL view) of the X12 agreement you deployed earlier.
trans-unit.target: You can get the endpoint from Send Settings tab (Inbound URL view) of the X12 agreement you deployed earlier.

trans-unit.source: The endpoint is typically in the format <codeInline>https://<legacyItalic>mybiztalkservice</legacyItalic>.biztalk.windows.net/default/Agreements/<legacyItalic>%%amp;lt;id%%amp;gt;</legacyItalic>/Send</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The endpoint is typically in the format <codeInline>https://<legacyItalic>mybiztalkservice</legacyItalic>.biztalk.windows.net/default/Agreements/<legacyItalic>%%amp;lt;id%%amp;gt;</legacyItalic>/Send</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: ContainerName
trans-unit.target: ContainerName

trans-unit.source: Enter the blob container where the X12 850 purchase order messages are dropped.
trans-unit.target: Enter the blob container where the X12 850 purchase order messages are dropped.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, enter this value as <userInput>purchaseorder</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, enter this value as <userInput>purchaseorder</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: You created this container in the earlier steps.
trans-unit.target: You created this container in the earlier steps.

trans-unit.source: CloudStorageAccountConectionString
trans-unit.target: CloudStorageAccountConectionString

trans-unit.source: Select the ellipsis (<embeddedLabel>…</embeddedLabel>) against the property and in the dialog box, enter the storage account name and the account access key.
trans-unit.target: Select the ellipsis (<embeddedLabel>…</embeddedLabel>) against the property and in the dialog box, enter the storage account name and the account access key.

trans-unit.source: Select the option to use HTTPS connections, and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select the option to use HTTPS connections, and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: ContentTypeValue
trans-unit.target: ContentTypeValue

trans-unit.source: For content type, enter <userInput>application/xml</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For content type, enter <userInput>application/xml</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Save changes to the project.
trans-unit.target: Save changes to the project.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the solution name in the Solution Explorer, and then select <embeddedLabel>Build</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the solution name in the Solution Explorer, and then select <embeddedLabel>Build</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: After the build completes successfully, right-click the <embeddedLabel>BlobPollerRole</embeddedLabel> in the Solution Explorer, then select <embeddedLabel>Package</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: After the build completes successfully, right-click the <embeddedLabel>BlobPollerRole</embeddedLabel> in the Solution Explorer, then select <embeddedLabel>Package</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the dialog box that appears, for <embeddedLabel>Service configuration</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Cloud</embeddedLabel>; and for <embeddedLabel>Build configuration</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Release</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the dialog box that appears, for <embeddedLabel>Service configuration</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Cloud</embeddedLabel>; and for <embeddedLabel>Build configuration</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Release</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Once the operation successfully completes, you will see that two files are created in the \BlobPoller\bin\Release\app-publish directory.
trans-unit.target: Once the operation successfully completes, you will see that two files are created in the \BlobPoller\bin\Release\app-publish directory.

trans-unit.source: In the next step, you upload these files to your <token>azure_2</token> subscription to deploy the worker role.
trans-unit.target: In the next step, you upload these files to your <token>azure_2</token> subscription to deploy the worker role.

trans-unit.source: Deploy the worker role on Azure
trans-unit.target: Deploy the worker role on Azure

trans-unit.source: Open the <token>azure_2</token> Management Portal, and from the command bar, point to <embeddedLabel>New</embeddedLabel>, <embeddedLabel>Compute</embeddedLabel>, <embeddedLabel>Cloud Service</embeddedLabel>, and then select <embeddedLabel>Quick Create</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Open the <token>azure_2</token> Management Portal, and from the command bar, point to <embeddedLabel>New</embeddedLabel>, <embeddedLabel>Compute</embeddedLabel>, <embeddedLabel>Cloud Service</embeddedLabel>, and then select <embeddedLabel>Quick Create</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Enter a URL for the worker role, select a region where the role will be deployed, and then select the checkmark.
trans-unit.target: Enter a URL for the worker role, select a region where the role will be deployed, and then select the checkmark.

trans-unit.source: Select the cloud service you created, select the Instances tab, make sure the <embeddedLabel>Production</embeddedLabel> view is selected, and then select <embeddedLabel>Upload</embeddedLabel> from the command bar.
trans-unit.target: Select the cloud service you created, select the Instances tab, make sure the <embeddedLabel>Production</embeddedLabel> view is selected, and then select <embeddedLabel>Upload</embeddedLabel> from the command bar.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Upload a Package</embeddedLabel> dialog box, do the following:
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Upload a Package</embeddedLabel> dialog box, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Provide a deployment label.
trans-unit.target: Provide a deployment label.

trans-unit.source: For <embeddedLabel>Package</embeddedLabel>, browse to the \BlobPoller\bin\Release\app.publish location, and select the service package file (.cspkg).
trans-unit.target: For <embeddedLabel>Package</embeddedLabel>, browse to the \BlobPoller\bin\Release\app.publish location, and select the service package file (.cspkg).

trans-unit.source: For <embeddedLabel>Configuration</embeddedLabel>, browse to the \BlobPoller\bin\Release\app.publish location, and select the cloud service configuration file (.cscfg).
trans-unit.target: For <embeddedLabel>Configuration</embeddedLabel>, browse to the \BlobPoller\bin\Release\app.publish location, and select the cloud service configuration file (.cscfg).

trans-unit.source: Select the checkbox to deploy the worker role even if it contains a single instance.
trans-unit.target: Select the checkbox to deploy the worker role even if it contains a single instance.

trans-unit.source: Select the checkbox if you want to start the worker role after it is uploaded.
trans-unit.target: Select the checkbox if you want to start the worker role after it is uploaded.

trans-unit.source: Select the checkmark.
trans-unit.target: Select the checkmark.

trans-unit.source: Once the worker role is deployed, it will start polling the blob you specified in the configuration, until you stop the role from the <token>portal</token>.
trans-unit.target: Once the worker role is deployed, it will start polling the blob you specified in the configuration, until you stop the role from the <token>portal</token>.
